pullRequest.title: Cb 8494 audit integration
pullRequest.bodyText: See detailed description in the commit message.

beforeCommit.message: CB-8494 Integrate Audit service with Environment service. Send the audit events to the central audit service

afterCommit.message: CB-8494 Integrate Audit service with Environment service. Send the audit events to the central audit service

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,5 +21,10 @@
     RETRY_DATALAKE_CLUSTER,
     INSTANCE_DELETE_DATALAKE_CLUSTER,
     MAINTAIN_DATALAKE_CLUSTER,
-    START_DATALAKE_CLUSTER
+    START_DATALAKE_CLUSTER,
+
+    CREATE_ENVIRONMENT,
+    DELETE_ENVIRONMENT,
+    STOP_ENVIRONMENT,
+    START_ENVIRONMENT

nodes.bodyText: EnvironmentCreationFlowOperation.... would sound better to me, what do yo think?
One return statement would be easier to read.

It indicates the type of the given operation and JSON deserialisation logic uses that field. I wouldn't change it, because it has already fixed previously to work properly. Please test it with querying events from the backend, because I am sure this change would break get operation on structured events.
Shouldn't we be prepared for cases when Reactor is not able to process the event?
I think a happy log message could be welcomed here :)
Warn level should be enough here, as it is just a warning without propagating any error about that the audit event could not be send and/or processed.
Is this implemented somewhere? or it is for future purposes?
